examples: when did you last see him?
since when have you been interested?

relative adverb.description: At or on which (referring to a time or circumstance)
examples: Saturday is the day when I get my hair done

conjunction.description: At or during the time that.
examples: I loved math when I was in school

conjunction.description: After which; and just then (implying suddenness)
examples: he had just drifted off to sleep when the phone rang

conjunction.description: In view of the fact that; considering that.
examples: why bother to paint it when you can photograph it with the same effect?
I'm saying it now when I should have told you long ago

origin: Old English hwanne, hwenne; of Germanic origin; related to German wenn if, wann when.
